_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four mangoes [an4.105:5.7]: One is unripe but seems ripe
One is ripe but seems unripe
One is unripe and seems unripe
One is ripe and seems ripe
One is unripe but seems ripe
One is ripe but seems unripe
One is unripe and seems unripe
One is ripe and seems ripe
The characteristics of a person who is u: Impressive when going out and coming back
Impressive when looking ahead and aside
Impressive when bending and extending the limbs
Impressive when bearing the outer robe, bowl, and robes
They don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person who is r: They really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person who is u: They don’t really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
The characteristics of a person who is r: They really understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’
